headline: Pumpkin Pancakes
description: These pumpkin pancakes are flavored with ginger, cinnamon, and allspice, can be made with fresh or canned pumpkin, and make a perfect fall breakfast.

video.description: See how to make spiced pumpkin pancakes.
video.name: Pumpkin Pancakes

name: Pumpkin Pancakes

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together milk, pumpkin, egg, oil, and vinegar in a large bowl until well combined.
Whisk together flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, allspice, cinnamon, ginger, and salt in a separate bowl. Add to pumpkin mixture; whisk just until combined.
Spray a griddle or frying pan with cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat.
Pour 3 to 4 tablespoons batter for each pancake onto the hot griddle and flatten batter slightly with a spoon.
Cook until small bubbles appear, about 2 minutes.
Flip and cook until golden brown, about 2 more minutes. Repeat with remaining batter.

review.reviewBody: Meh. The flavor was okay, but what really brought the rating down was the consistency of the batter. It was just way too thick. It refused to spread on the skillet, so I had to spread it with a spoon. Even so--even after adding additional milk to thin out the batter--cooking them long enough to cook the center resulted in a burnt exterior. The inside was gummy, even when fully cooked. For the record, I have no problem with "plain", buttermilk or banana pancakes; just these.

Great pumpkin pancakes! My 7 year old daughter loves them. I wish it had a little more spice so next time I'll be adding a bit more allspice and ginger. My batter came out a bit thicker than I'm used to so I'll be adding a splash more of milk also.

Best recipe ever for pumpkin pancakes - YUM! We had these twice they were so good: Serves 2 people over 2 days - 8 fluffy pancakes total! I made 4 pancakes Sat., refrigerated unused batter, then made 4 more Sun. from this recipe. The only variation I did was to add 1/4 tsp nutmeg and 1 tsp sugar. Canned pumpkin - was trying to use up canned pumpkin on-hand. Thanks so much for contributing this recipe to allrecipies!

We loved these light, fluffy pancakes. Since the spice was not as strong as our personal preference, I added pumpkin spice to the mixture which elevated the warmth and flavor. This will be a go-to recipe for us.
Easy to make! Did it with my toddler cooking class using a blender.

Very, very good pancakes. Super tall and fluffy. My only changes were I added chopped walnuts and used AC instead of white vinegar. One thing to add about vinegar, in addition to helping the rise as a chef pointed out in their review from last month, is that it turns the milk into buttermilk. Many home cooks use this hack rather than keeping buttermilk on hand for baking, etc. You don't taste the vinegar in the end product and you're actually making pumpkin buttermilk pancakes.. a win-win. Thanks for a really good recipe!
These are the best pumpkin pancakes Iâ€™ve made. I only added pecans and used whole wheat rather than white flour. Otherwise followed the recipe exactly.

I made these for my teenagers, and they absolutely loved it. I also used apple cider vinegar like another user because I didn't have white vinegar and it worked just as good. The pancakes were fluffy and absolutely delish! I spread peanut butter on mine with bananas & drizzled with syrup ðŸ˜‹

I made this exactly as the recipe called for and our family loved it. Now, they want these fluffy pumpkin pancakes instead of the standard buttermilk style. As the recipe only calls for one cup of pumpkin purÃ©e, I reserved the remainder in the can and used it as a topping for the finished pancakes. That was a hit and upped the pumpkin flavor that much more.
I used fresh pumpkin and it was really good. I also used fresh ginger. I am glad that I did to. Then I took the pumpkin seeds and put them in the air fryer.

This was absolutely delicious! I used fresh pumpkin and chose to use apple cider vinegar instead of white vinegar. I don't know if it made an astronomical difference, but the flavor was amazing. My kids and even my fussy dad loved them. I plan to keep this recipe and try using it with sweet potato for when I don't have fresh pumpkin available ðŸ˜Š
Best pancakes Iâ€™ve ever eaten! I thinned the batter out with some milk (kind of wished I hadnâ€™t) and they still ended up super fluffy! I used half the recipe and had a lot of leftovers to freeze.

Delicious! I love pumpkin flavored food, and this recipe did not disappoint. I omitted the seed vegetable oil and replaced it with 1 Tbsp of melted butter & added 1/2 scoop of pumpkin protein powder as well.

So good! Didnâ€™t have all the spices listed but I did have a pumpkin spice blend so I added a tbsp of that, next time Iâ€™ll probably add 1.5-2 tbsp of the pumpkin spice blend unless I get the spices listed then I will follow that recommendation, but delicious and I will be making again! My daughter loves chocolate chip pancakes so I added so to these and she devoured them!
I made these pancakes with my preschoolers, and they loved making them! The recipe was easy to follow, and they devoured them!!!
I wasnâ€™t sure if I would like the spices. I used 1 tsp Cinnamon and 1/2 tsp ground cloves. These were beautiful and delicious. Next time I will try the spices that it calls for. Great recipe ðŸ¥ž

Great recipe with or without syrup! We had leftovers that I stored in a gallon baggie in the refrigerator. For the next few days I pulled two out each morning, popped them in the toaster and ate them plain, and on the run, on the way to work. They were so flavorful that I didnâ€™t miss the syrup! I plan to make this a fall staple for breakfast food.

Made this for breakfast this morning for the first time. I read all the reviews and saw such varying results that I was a bit concerned, but as a professional chef, it looked like a good recipe with appropriate amounts of spice vs pumpkin. Not everyone is going to like a given recipe; that is why there are so many different versions of a recipe available; people have different tastes in food. First: Pumpkin pancakes are more moist than regular pancakes. Second: Regular pancake recipe usually do not contain sugar. Pancakes are, traditionally, not sweet. The syrup makes them sweet. I absolutely love this recipe! My husband had seconds and also thought they were great. I only made one (necessary) alteration. I used almond milk as I cannot drink cow's milk. These pancakes are light (for those who cringe at the thought of vinegar in their pancakes, it does not taste and its purpose is to react with the soda to help the pancakes rise, which it did very successfully in this light and tasty pancake. The pancake is not overly spiced; you can taste the delicate pumpkin flavor instead of all the spices, which is a good thing. Now for my rant! I do not understand why people alter a recipe and then write a bad review. If you are going to review a recipe, try it as written and review that. Then make any changes you may feel necessary.
Absolutely the best pumpkin pancake recipe! I have made this recipe twice now and wouldn't change a thing. So fluffy, moist, and delicious!
Used Bisquick in place of flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. They came out perfect and delicious!
These were delicious! My whole family raved about them! Made just as the directions say.
Needed to be cooked 25Â°F cooler and slightly longer than traditional pancakes. Great flavor!
Wonderful recipe! I followed the recipe and added quarter cup of pecans. This is a keeper. The spices remind me of pumpkin pie and the pancakes are very fluffy. Lover of pumpkin anything.
Better than any pumpkin pancake I've had in a restaurant. Perfection!
No allspice added 1/4 tsp cardamom and 1/4 tsp nutmeg
Iâ€™ve made it before.
Terrible recipe, move on to the next one. Way too much spice and can't even taste the pumpkin... If you relabel this as a spice pancake, then you would get 5*.

Followed it exactly EXCEPT that instead of pureed pumpkin, I used purÃ©ed and drained green tomatoes. They are a hit. As with pumpkin pancakes, they are tender, so a little challenging to freeze, but it is doable and it helps me make the most of my garden.

This is the best pumpkin pancake recipe. I have been making it for years. I have an egg allergy, and I use the Bob's Red Mill egg substitute and it works great. The pancakes are still very fluffy. I use 4 TB brown sugar instead of 3. I double the cinnamon, and I use buttermilk instead of regular milk. Oh and I add 1 tsp of vanilla extract.
These taste pretty good on their own, I ended up using water (because I ran outta milk) and had to add a bit more, but overall good turn out
I gave this a five star rating and I didnâ€™t change a single thing on it. It made 10- 4 inch diameter, delicious pancakes. It is a new staple for our familyâ€™s holiday breakfasts!

Lovely pancakes! Paired with real maple syrup, these were a huge treat on a cold Sunday morning!
I suggest cooking them at a lower heat than you normally use, because these are very thick. I usually set my griddle to 375, but these needed, at highest, 350.
I used Kodiak mix. Because I used only 1 cup of mix I added 1/2 cup pumpkin, pumpkin pie spice (I just eyeballed it) and pecans. Delicious!
This is a keeper using some of the modifications suggested by another reviewer (no ginger or allspice, more cinnamon , add nutmeg). I also used a bit more p
Awesome pancakes!!
I switched out the egg and used Bob's Egg Replacer and used almond milk. Doing so made it vegan. This is the best pumpkin pancake I've ever had.
Terrible, batter is way to thick to cook properly, had to thin it considerably . As others suggested added nutmeg and reduces vinegar.
Followed Nancy's simplification and they turned out fantastic!

I made the recipe as is except for using more spice and adding a dash of vanilla. I did mix wet ingredients w/a handmixer. Batter is a bit too thick for me,altho maybe if I make again I will do a better job of spreading the batter. I thought they were just ok - however my friend LOVED them.

I loved these - the taste was amazing (I upped the spices a bit and added a extra tsp of cinnamon and pumpkin pie spice)- used the quick recipe found in one of the reviews but I will say it burns really fast (at least on my stove) so keep the heat low and watch them. I wasn't sure of the vinegar but you can't taste it.
Excellent and easy recipe. Topped it with butter, pure maple syrup and coconut cream whipped topping....plus a tiny pinch of pumpkin spice. Yummo!

Made this recipe and followed almost to a 2 with the following changes: 1. upped pumpkin to 1 1/3 cups 2. upped cinnamon to 1 tbsp. 3. subbed melted butter for oil (same amount) 4. followed the milk amount loosely- I might have added a bit more to thin out but not too much- batter should be thick but not too thick

These came out so good! I only made some very slight changes; I used pumpkin spice instead of the separate spices and I added the vinegar to the milk and let it sit for a few minutes while I combined the other ingredients before adding it to the batter. Otherwise I kept to the original recipe and these turned out great! The batter wasnâ€™t too thick, the pancakes were light and fluffy, and plenty of delicious pumpkin flavor.
Really not great. They're just bland pancakes colored orange. Definitely needs more sugar and more flavor
These pancakes were so good my daughter sang a song about them. Excellent!

I agree- to rate this proper make as it is in recipe. Than add your changes. I finally found a pumpkin pancake recipe my family loves. The 2nd time I made these I subbed a cup of wheat flour for almond flour (lowering carbs) . no one noticed! These are tasty. I used organic pumpkin, canned, which was tasty. Going to try fresh next time. I also added a cup of chopped pecans 2nd time.. yum!
Perfect.

I love this recipe I did change it up a bit. On the spices I took out the ginger, oil and vinagre, I got really creative and used a box mixture of fluffy pancakes and added 1 egg and instead of water like the box called for I used milk for the Pumpkin purÃ©e I used 1cup and As far as the spices I used 2tsp of each pumpkin spice, cinnamon, nutmeg, 1 tsp vanilla, top it with pumpkin syrupâ€¦Delicious will make this again and againâ€¦.
It was very damp inside--even after long and slow cooking (medium temp cooking left it blackened on the outside and wetter on the inside). The flavor was good, though.
I followed the recipe exactly and it was so wet on the insides. like i cooked each pancake for like 5 minutes on each side.
Delicious. Also great the next day cold, rolled up with butter, sugar and cinnamon.
Very good

These pancakes are the best pancakes Iâ€™ve ever had! I advise adding two spoonfuls of white sugar. I think it makes them more fluffy and soft and maybe a tiny bit better??? Anyway I would do it. As I was saying these are probably the best pancakes Iâ€™ve ever had. You should try these pancakes sometime!?

Easy and delicious with plain yogurt and maple syrup. Mmmm

Changed flour to using almond flour, whole wheat flour, flax and hemp seed; used maple syrup instead of brown sugar cooked them longer on lower heat. They are thinner and rich .
One of our favorites!
I used my whole wheat pancake mix recipe, added the spices, and adjusted the milk to my desired consistency. Turned out great!

Milk & vinegar are a substitute for buttermilk, so use buttermilk. I made the recipe exactly as written and found the flavor fat too weak and the consistency too thick. I read the reviews and tried the recipe again only this time I with the changes suggested by the reviewer "RobNMandy" and it came out great! Everyone raved over them.
Delicious
I follow the recipe to a T and these turn out perfect every time. Add some chocolate chips for those who like them and top with whip cream for a
Delish! And so easy.
No substitutions needed!! These pancakes are our new family favorite!
Very good but I added 2.5 cups of milk instead of 2 since original batter was too thick.

Fluffy. Delicious! Hard to stop eating them.
Substituted buttermilk for plain milk and Whole White Wheat for allpurpose flour. Added 1/2 tsp of pumpkin spice and a bit of chopped walnuts. If the batter is too thick add more milk 1tsp at a time till it reaches desired consistency.
These were super doughy- had to add an extra egg and more milk then they were perfect
Yummy. But very thick. after the first batch I added about 1/4 c water and they were still thick
I cheated and used the pancake mix shortcut another user posted as well as the recipe as posted. I routinely use the shortcut now. Both ways are very good
Loved them. They came out a little thick, but that was ok. Perhaps I need to adjust something?
Batter is way too thick, so does not cook through in a reasonable time, as batter stands too high on griddle.

This is the best pancake Iâ€™ve ever made! I made the recipe EXACTLY as written. When it came to cooking them I followed other reviewersâ€™ advice. I let the batter sit for about 5 minutes so the baking powder could activate. Each pancake was about 1/3 cup and I spread it out a bit in the pan. Good thing I did because they puffed up beautifully!
Great recipe. These turned out light and fluffy. The whole family loved them!
These were good but very dense. The batter was thick, but I assume this was due to the added pumpkin? Any suggestions for a lighter and fluffier pancake?
Nice and moist but very lacking in flavor

Very yummy! I've made this twice in the last two weeks. But both times I added about 1/4 tsp of nutmeg to round out the pumpkin pie flavor. Also, the batter was very thick, I thought, and so I added almost another 1/2 cup of milk so that it would spread out more readily when poured on the griddle.

I used the tweeked version of this recipe from another reviewer and added to it. I used about 1.5 cups of pumpkins and added vanilla and butterscotch chips and due to a salt allergy I competly omitted the salt and it came out fantastic! They are super dense, sweet and don't really need any kind of syrup. I munched on them dry as I made them and they were very good right off the stove

i have made this recipe twice now and it is simple to make and tastes great. i make it exactly as directed. the recipe makes 12 pancakes for me! great pumpkin flavor and they come out nice and fluffy. i can keep them in the fridge for a week. highly recommend!

I made this recipe exactly, without any changes, except for having to thin the batter repeatedly with more milk, which didn't help. Turning up the temp on the griddle didn't help, nor did cooking them longer. These pancakes wouldn't cook through; it was as if the interior is supposed to be mushy like pumpkin pie?? If you read the other 1 & 2-star reviews, I agree with everything that was said. I don't understand the high ratings for these pancakes.
Fluffy, tender yummy pancakes! Not overly â€œpumpkinny â€œ!

This was amazing. I followed the recipe as stated except I was out of regular vinegar, so I used 1 Tbsp of Rice Vinegar and 1 Tbsp of White Wine Vinegar. I was surprised there was even a call for vinegar but it balances out perfectly. Additionally, I also happened to be out of maple syrup so I used agave nectar, and it paired perfectly. Great recipe. The batter runs a little thin, so just make sure to give it plenty enough time to cook on your griddle before trying to flip it.
They were not as pumpkiny as I'd hoped-for. They looked yummy though!
Super recipe!
Great I didn't have allspice but just used 2 tsp.. cinnamon and ginger and it was good. Will try with more spices when I can.
delicious! swapped almond milk, and added 2 tsp of pumpkin pie spice instead of individual spices. topped with coconut whipped cream and Graham cracker crumbs
Fantastic. I used unsweetened almond milk instead of regular milk. These pancakes were fluffy and delicious. Iâ€™ll definitely be making them again
Amazing flavor and texture. Served with apple maple chicken sausage and fruit for the perfect fall brunch.
Itâ€™s a family favorite here! We double the recipe because people love it so much and we like a few extra for the freezer
Followed it exactly and loved it! I thought the pumpkin flavor was just enough, and the texture was perfectly fluffy and rich. Would make again!

I made this recipe and even did some of the recommended changes. I have to say Iâ€™ve never been more disappointed. I have an old banana pancake recipe that my grandmother gave me. I just changed the bananas for pumpkin purÃ©e and the cinnamon for pumpkin spice and BAM! Amazing!
The recipe was so easy and delicious! I made pancakes and put the leftover batter in the fridge. The next day I made waffles in my waffle iron. They wee perfect!
Delicious. The whole family lived it.

This was really thick. I went with the suggestions and didnâ€™t add milk at first and made one pancake as is. (I doubled the recipe and used 1 can of pumpkin and an individual serving of applesauce.) However, it was more like a cookie. It didnâ€™t cook on the griddle and needed more of an oven cooking than being cooked like a pancake. I tried round two and added some milk, but it was still too thick. Round three I added lots more milk, two eggs, and another round of brown sugar. It was good and still tasted pretty good. But based on the recipe, this is a solid 2 stars in my book. Probably 3.5 stars with adjustments.
I have made these using both canned pumpkin and leftover sweet potatoes. They are excellent. Light in texture and slightly spicy. I also used almond milk with no issues at all.
Love'em and great way to use some leftover or extra pumpkin.
I used half the amount of oil and used half the amount of vinegar, replacing it with apple cider vinegar. Added whipped cream on top and a few sprinkles of cinnamon and voila!
awesomely delicious. I used 1 1/2 cups pumpkin because the first batch was not that pumpkiny

Delicious and fluffy! I made a couple of adjustments: doubled eggs (so I could halve the recipe), used Apple cider vinegar and evaporated milk, replaced half allspice with nutmeg. Cook at medium-low. Half a recipe made about nine 4" pancakes.

Loved these pancakes. I made a couple changes after reading the reviews (no all spice, no vinegar, a little extra pumpkin purÃ©e). I did find they were very thick, and had to play with the heat and spreading them out with a spoon to get them to cook through. But they were very tasty and I will definitely be making them again.

I have to say these pancakes are delicious. I made them exactly as the recipe specifies. Everyone who had them was delighted. One note, I only recently learned that weighing your flour is better than scooping into a cup measure. 120 grams per cup. That way you make them consistently every time. Maple syrup goes great with the pancakes as does whipped cream. Thank you!
Love this recipe, but I added an egg, more cinnamon, and nutmeg. Also, I reduced allspice and ginger.
Great recipe just as it is! No moderations necessary.
